Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed (2/30) bookended the innings, dismissing opener Michael Levitt (18) and cleaning up Tim Pringle (1) off the final ball of the match to seal the win in style.
Vikramjit Singh slams three mighty hits against Bangladesh.

Shakib (0/29 from 4) was the only one of the six Bangladesh bowlers not to pick up wickets on the day, as Rishad Hossain finished with leading figures of 3/33 from his four overs, and Mustafizur Rahman delivered a masterclass with economical returns of 1/12 from his four.
Sybrand Engelbrecht took a stunning catch for Netherlands against Bangladesh in Barbados, 16 years after he pulled off another blinding bit of fielding for South Africa.
Tanzid Hasan's helmet got stuck in the grill during Bangladesh's match against Netherlands.
Aryan Dutt proved tricky to get away in the Powerplay, picking up the wickets of Najmul Hossain Shanto and Litton Das, with the latter falling to an outrageous catch by Sybrand Engelbrecht.

Paul van Meekeren stemmed the flow of the runs when he had Tanzid caught in the deep, and Tim Pringle struck to remove a bogged down Towhid Hridoy (9 from 15) as pace off proved the most effective option for the Dutch on a sticky surface.

Bangladesh were able to add late runs as Netherlands returned to their death bowlers, with Shakib playing a superb hand, allowing Mahmudullah (25 from 21) and Jaker Ali (14 from 7) to let fly at the other end.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh beat the Netherlands to enhance their chances of a place in the second round of the T20 World Cup 2024.
The result puts Bangladesh in control of their fate in Group D and the likely qualifiers along with South Africa.
The Netherlands still have an outside chance of qualifying, but the permutations are complicated with just one match, against Sri Lanka, still to play.
Bangladesh's win over Netherlands puts them in a strong position to qualify for the Super 8 stage at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup with victory over Netherlands in Barbados.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bangladesh bowlers completed the job, restricting the Dutch to 134/8 in the chase, 25 runs short.
Shakib Al Hasan starred with a half-century in Bangladesh's win over Netherlands.
Wickets fell too frequently for the Dutch to sustain their required run-rate, and their attempt fizzled out with the target still 25 runs away at the close.
Bangladesh took control of their fate in Group D with the win over Netherlands.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The ball got stuck in Tanzid Hasan's helmet during Bangladesh's match against Netherlands.
Aryan Dutt (2/17 in 4 overs) and medium-pacer Paul van Meekeren (2/15 in 4) proved by far the most effective bowlers for the Dutch on a sticky surface.
The result puts Bangladesh in control of their fate in Group D and the likely qualifiers along with South Africa.
Bangladesh's win over Netherlands puts them in a strong position to qualify for the Super 8 stage at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup with victory over Netherlands in Barbados.
Others: 'Out of this World' by Sean Paul and Kes: The official ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 anthem
The official ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 anthem was played during the match between Bangladesh and Netherlands.
